```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE,
                      warning = FALSE,
                      message = FALSE)
library(tidyverse)
library(here)
library(purrr)
```

```{r car_sample}
possible_cars = data.frame(name = c("A","B","C","D"),
                           mass=c(10000,65000,38000,30000), 
                           area = c(22,30,22,10))
```

```{r highways}
nsample = 100
crolling_100 = runif(n =nsample, min = 0.01, max = 0.03)

head(crolling)
```

```{r power}
# 120 km/h --> m/s
speed = 33.3

# call our function
source(here("R", "vehicle_power.R"))

v_power(v =1, m =1, A = 1, c_rolling = 1)
```

```{r for-loop}
# make a data frame to store the outputs
power_df = as.data.frame(matrix(nrow=length(crolling), ncol=nrow(possible_cars)))

# build for-loop
for (i in 1:nrow(possible_cars)) {
  power_df[,i] = v_power(A=possible_cars$area[i], m=possible_cars$mass[i], v=speed, c_rolling = crolling_100)
}

# assign column names
colnames(power_df) = possible_cars$name

# pivot longer
power_df_pivot <- power_df %>% pivot_longer(cols = everything(),
                                            names_to = "Car",
                                            values_to = "Power")

```

```{r box plot}
# create box plot
cars_box <- ggplot() +
  geom_boxplot(data = power_df_pivot, aes(x = Car, y = Power))

# call box plot
cars_box
```

```{r with pmap}
# recreate for loop in pmap
power_2 = pmap(list(A = possible_cars$area, m = possible_cars$mass), v_power, v = speed, c_rolling = crolling_100)

# convert to data frame
power_2_df = as.data.frame(power_2, col.names = possible_cars$name)

# pivot longer
power_2_df_pivot <-  power_2_df %>% pivot_longer(cols = everything(),
                                                 names_to = "Car",
                                                 values_to = "Power")

# make second box plot
cars_box_2 <- ggplot() +
  geom_boxplot(data = power_2_df_pivot, aes(x = Car, y = Power))

# call box plot
cars_box_2
```
